timeline.bodyText: Might be better to separate the support level (JVM and native) out into it's own heading. WDYT?
timeline.author: jamesnetherton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+// Do not edit directly!
+// This file was generated by camel-quarkus-package-maven-plugin:update-extension-doc-page
+
+[[activemq]]
+= ActiveMQ
+
+*Since Camel Quarkus 1.0.0-M5, JVM and native*

replies.bodyText:
Yes, I am not 100% satisfied with this part too. I'd personally prefer some sort of badges visually similar to these

I'd try to find some antora/css expert once the first iteration is online.
replies.author: ppalaga

timeline.bodyText: Maybe 'Included components'? I don't want to get too hung up on wording so if you disagree, that's ok.
timeline.author: jamesnetherton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+// Do not edit directly!
+// This file was generated by camel-quarkus-package-maven-plugin:update-extension-doc-page
+
+[[activemq]]
+= ActiveMQ
+
+*Since Camel Quarkus 1.0.0-M5, JVM and native*
+
+Send messages to (or consume from) Apache ActiveMQ. This component extends the Camel JMS component.
+
+== What's inside

replies.bodyText: The problem with "components" on this level is that technically not only components can be listed here: there can also be languages, data formats and "others". How about Included Camel bits?
replies.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: Yes, true.... I'm happy to leave it as-is for now.
replies.author: jamesnetherton

timeline.bodyText: 'for usage details' instead of 'for the usage'
timeline.author: jamesnetherton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+// Do not edit directly!

+

+= ActiveMQ
+

+
+Send messages to (or consume from) Apache ActiveMQ. This component extends the Camel JMS component.
+
+== What's inside
+
+* https://camel.apache.org/components/latest/activemq-component.html[ActiveMQ component]
+
+Please refer to the above links for the usage.

timeline.bodyText: The change of ordering does not look right. Let me check.
